heading: IMPORTANT NOTICE
text: Data contained document preliminary subject changes publication final ACE 2020 benchmarking report May 2022.

heading: 1 Introduction
text:
ACE benchmarking work commissioned Performance Review Commission (PRC) carried EUROCONTROL Performance Review Unit (PRU) using information provided Air Navigation Services Providers (ANSPs) compliance Decision . 88 Permanent Commission EUROCONTROL economic information disclosure.data processing, analysis reporting conducted assistance ACE Working Group, comprises representatives participating ANSPs, airspace users, regulatory authorities Performance Review Unit. enables participants share experiences establish common understanding underlying assumptions limitations data.objective document provide first insight level 2020 cost-effectiveness performance Pan-European system individual ANSPs release ACE 2020 benchmarking report, planned end May 2022. also presents specific financial indicators can used monitor potential cash liquidity issues experienced ANSPs result COVID-19 pandemic. Figure 1.1 illustrates timeline production ACE 2020 benchmarking report.
Figure 1.1: Timeline production ACE 2020 benchmarking report
important robust ACE benchmarking analysis available timely manner since several stakeholders, notably ANSPs’ management, regulatory authorities (e.g. NSAs) airspace users, keen interest receiving information ACE reports early possible.noted data presented document still preliminary yet fully validated. data reflect information stored ACE database 11th November 2021. Figure 1.2 shows status ACE data validation process data presented document.
Figure 1.2: Status 2020 data validation process
data contained report therefore subject changes release final ACE 2020 benchmarking report May 2022.Figure 1.3 shows 20 ANSPs provided ACE 2020 data submission time 1st July 2021 , total, 26 data submissions received 15th July 2021. Figure 1.3 also indicates 11 ANSPs ACE data submission received one month deadline.
Figure 1.3: Status ACE 2020 data submission
Clearly, timescale production ACE benchmarking report inevitably delayed data submitted time.remainder report organised follows:Section 2: provides high-level presentation 2020 revenues, costs staff data;Section 3: presents preliminary analysis economic cost-effectiveness Pan-European ANSP level;Section 4: presents preliminary analysis financial cost-effectiveness Pan-European ANSP level, underlying components.Section 5: presents preliminary analysis specific financial indicators Pan-European ANSP level.

chapter: 2 High-level revenues, costs and staff data

text:
section provides preliminary presentation high-level revenues, costs staff data provided ANSPs ACE 2020 data submissions. Total ANS revenues 2020 amounted €4 502M. en-route revenues come collection en-route charges (91.4%, see left pie chart). proportion terminal revenues charges lower (50.9%, see right pie chart), additional income may directly come airport operators (31.2% e.g. contractual arrangement ANSP airport operator).

Across Pan-European system, traffic 2020 (measured composite flight-hours) -56.8% lower 2019 total gate--gate revenues fell -53.1%. context also changes composition ANSPs revenues, since outbreak COVID-19 affect sources revenues proportion.revenue items increased 2020, income exempted flights (+11.3%), income domestic governments (+11.3%) revenues (+21.6%). However, increases (+€46M) remain marginal compared drop en-route terminal charges revenues (-€4 982 M) Pan-European level. Operating costs (including staff costs, non-staff operating costs exceptional cost items) accounted 84% total ATM/CNS provision costs, depreciation costs cost capital represented 16%.

2020, five largest ANSPs (ENAIRE, ENAV, DFS, DSNA NATS) bore 56% total Pan-European gate--gate ATM/CNS provision costs, five smallest ANSPs accounted 1% (see bottom left part Figure 2.3).ATM/CNS provision costs increased +1.3% p.. 2015 2019, fell -5.0% 2020 ANSPs implemented range measures reduce costs preserve liquidities. shown bottom right part Figure 2.3, -5.0% decrease ATM/CNS costs 2020 reflects reductions 31 38 ANSPs. details changes ANSPs ATM/CNS provision costs 2020 available final ACE 2020 benchmarking report.response challenges presented extraordinary drop traffic, ANSPs implemented range cost-containment measures 2020, leading overall reduction ATM/CNS costs -€433.4M.full effect measures however yet visible 2020 data since, instance, redundancy plans negotiated year actual impact number staff, staff costs, become visible 2021 data. ANSPs implementing redundancy plans 2020 even recorded cost increases year, reflecting provisions payments staff made redundant. main driver increase exceptional costs +€55.6M.Staff costs far main source savings 2020 (-€315.6M), due implementation following measures:Short-time work / furlough schemes, applicable, part employees’ salaries paid State either directly employees reducing ANSPs wage bill.Reduced staff numbers (discussed ).Reduced level remuneration reduction freeze base salaries, reduction suspension variable part salaries overtime payments performance bonuses.majority ANSPs also reduced non-staff operating costs carrying essential maintenance, reducing utilities costs non-essential training activities. resulted decrease -€39.2M.Finally, cancellation deferral non-essential investments resulted lower depreciation costs (-€51.0M) lower cost capital (-€83.2M). latter also impacted, many cases, use lower weighted average cost capital 2020.

Pan-European employed total 55 712 staff 2020 (comprising 54 871 staff providing ATM/CNS services 845 internal MET staff). 17 400 staff (32%) ATCOs working operational duty, split ACCs (56%) APP/TWR facilities (44%). average, 2.2 additional staff required every ATCO OPS Europe.

chapter: 5 ANSPs Cash and Liquidity Issues as a Result of the Covid-19 Pandemic
heading: 5 ANSPs Cash and Liquidity Issues as a Result of the Covid-19 Pandemic
text: section provides preliminary analysis specific financial indicators can used monitor potential cash liquidity issues experienced ANSPs result COVID-19 pandemic. structured three parts:changes ANSPs balance sheet structure Pan-European system level 2019 2020;presentation three financial indicators can calculated ACE data submissions (current ratio, cash--hand days equity ratio); ,presentation free cash flow indicator, calculated ANSPs financial statements.Due specific organisational financial set HCAA, LVNL MUAC, three ANSPs excluded analysis presented section.

chapter: 5 ANSPs Cash and Liquidity Issues as a Result of the Covid-19 Pandemic
heading: 5.1 Changes in the balance sheet structure
text:
Figure 5.1 presents changes ANSPs balance sheet structure reported ACE data submissions “Total ANS” level (.e. en-route, terminal ANS). scope therefore wider gate--gate ATM/CNS used calculate ACE key performance indicators, depending ANSPs include “ANS,” might necessarily match whole activities ANSP.
Figure 5.1: Changes ANSPs balance sheet structure (2019-2020)
assets side, shares NBV fixed assets operations current assets fell -5 -6 percent points, respectively. meantime share long-term financial assets receivables rose +12 percentage points, mainly due large -recoveries 2020 charged future years.liabilities side, share capital reserves fell -11 percentage points (-€1.1 billion) mainly due recording losses 2020. meantime, share long-term liabilities rose +11 percentage points several ANSPs contracted new loans drew existing loan facilities order respond liquidity issues continue invest priority projects. Short long-term borrowings rose +€2.5 billion 2020 (+134%).Although level capex reduced -26% (-€0.4 billion), still represents €1 billion expenditures.

chapter: 5 ANSPs Cash and Liquidity Issues as a Result of the Covid-19 Pandemic
heading: 5.2 Financial indicators calculated from ANSPs ACE data submissions
text:
current ratio, cash--hand days, equity ratio can calculated using balance sheet information submitted ACE total ANS level. details ratios defined purposes analysis, along limitations, please refer Section 3.4 ACE 2019 report. detailed analysis changes indicators provided ACE 2020 benchmarking report.Figures show 1st quartile2, Pan-European system average3 3rd quartile three indicators changes average 2015-2019 period year 20204.
Figure 5.2: Changes ANSPs balance sheet structure (2019-2020)
current ratio measures ability company pay short-term debt obligations current assets. value 1 suggests financial well-organisation, can settle short-term debt obligations current assets.2020, average current ratio Pan-European level amounted 2.6, -28% compared 2015-2019 period.Cash--hand days measures length time company can pay operating costs cash reserves.2020, average cash--hand days Pan-European level amounted 136 days, 34 days (-20%) lower 2015-2019 period.equity ratio measures share company’s balance sheet (total assets total liabilities) financed equity. high ratio can indicate relatively strong position case economic downturn since company less debt reimburse might also able obtain loans easily.2020, average equity ratio Pan-European level amounted 0.4, -19% compared 2015-2019 period.

chapter: 5 ANSPs Cash and Liquidity Issues as a Result of the Covid-19 Pandemic
heading: 5.3 Cash flow indicators calculated from ANSPs financial statements
text:
Free cash flow indicator widely used aviation industry stakeholders. presented organisational level, based information reported ANSPs’ financial statements. Depending organisational set ANSPs, information may cover wider scope activities scope reported ACE submissions “Total ANS.” case DFS, financial reporting standards used establish route charges ACE reporting (regulatory accounting) also different reporting standards used DFS financial statements (IFRS).free cash flow revenues ratio provides representation cash generated operations (accounting capital investments) available repay creditors pay dividends interests investors. can therefore broken two elements: ) net cash operating activities b) capital expenditures (CAPEX). Dividing ratios revenues allows easier interpretation indicators looking organisations different size.
Figure 5.3: 2019-2020 trends free cash flow revenues ratio ANSP level
Figure 5.3 shows 2019-2020 changes free cash flow revenues ratio (components) ANSP level 24 ANSPs data publically available time writing report5.Whereas 15 ANSPs positive ratio 2019, ANSPs analysed (exception Albcontrol) negative ratio 2020. Although changes free cash flow mainly driven changes net cash flow operating activities (see middle chart Figure 5.3), interesting note free cash flow negative 2019, several cases due relatively large capital expenditures year (e.g. 2019, Sakaeronavigatsia LGS respectively invested 37% 29% revenues).detailed analysis changes free cash flow revenues ratio provided ACE 2020 benchmarking report.analysis ANSPs indicators shows situation deteriorated several criteria:ability cover short-term debt using current assets reduced almost one third compared 2015-2019 period (current ratio falling 3.6 2.6).Cash reserves end 2020 sufficient cover 136 days operating expenses (34 days less 2015-2019 period). interpreting indicator, important consider fact loans contracted fully used 2020 appear cash balance sheet.equity ratio around 0.4 end 2020, lower 0.5 measured 2015-2019 period. reduction results combination ) lower capital reserves due losses incurred 2020 b) increase borrowings.Based sample 24 ANSPs, net cash flow operating activities 2020 became negative (-€1.5 billion compared €2.0 billion 2020). also considering cash outflow capital expenditures, free cash flow amounted -€2.2 billion 2020.
